text: every great turn of history's wheel
takes us in a new direction but the
destination is not easily discernible
because the lessons of history are not
fixed and immutable that remains true
today as it was 10 years ago it will
remain true 10 years from now and a
thousand years from now I spent a lot of
hours after that initial day thinking
about where we're going and how we might
get there I knew that there would be
change coming there had to be but what
form it would take was not clear to me I
was just trying to engage the my photo
citizens and a dialogue if you will
about how do we prepare for that change
what I didn't realize at the time is
that when we went to war and these were
going to be brutal wars in Iraq and
Afghanistan that we would be so
oblivious to the sacrifices that
military families were making as a
society we have less than one percent of
our population in military uniform doing
a hundred percent of the fighting for
the rest of us nothing was asked nothing
no it no additional taxes no sacrifices
at home we could choose to be ignorant
of what was going on in Iraq and
Afghanistan and it would not affect our
lives there are yellow ribbons on pickup
trucks and there are welcome home
committees at airports but
empathy is not enough we have to share
that sacrifice in some flash and a more
profound way it seems to me I would
change that and the election going into
2010 in midterm election I wrote an
op-ed page for the New York Times saying
what's not being discussed we're talking
about the economy we're talking about
political values there was almost no
discussion about these wars none and I
said at that time in the op-ed page that
this is unworthy of us that we all need
to be involved and to be thinking about
this I deal with a lot of families who
are worried about their children or have
lost a child or a father or a son or a
daughter or have had one of them
returned home gravely wounded and they
return to a society that is just going
about their business that's not just
undemocratic it's immoral
you
